etymology.description: 姚 (surname) + 滨/濱 (shore; waterfront) = personal name.
etymology.interpretation: A full Chinese name: 姚 is the family name, while 滨/濱 as a given name evokes the image of a shore or waterfront. Often chosen for its elegant sound and auspicious water connotations.
etymology.simplification: 濱 → 滨 by replacing the phonetic 賓 with its simplified form 宾 while retaining the water radical 氵; reduces strokes and regularizes the phonetic series.

examples.chinese: 姚滨是著名的花样滑冰教练(姚濱是著名的花樣滑冰教練)。
examples.pinyin: Yáo Bīn shì zhùmíng de huāyàng huábīng jiàoliàn.
examples.english: Yao Bin is a famous figure skating coach.

examples.chinese: 今天的发布会上，姚滨分享了训练经验(今天的發佈會上，姚濱分享了訓練經驗)。
examples.pinyin: Jīntiān de fābùhuì shàng, Yáo Bīn fēnxiǎng le xùnliàn jīngyàn.
examples.english: At today's press conference, Yao Bin shared training experience.
